results_summary:
COMPUTATIONAL DEMOCRATIC TENSION ANALYSIS: RESULTS SUMMARY

METHODOLOGY:
• Theoretical Framework: Orthogonal democratic tensions with Portuguese optimization
• Coordinate System: Discernus Coordinate System (DCS) Framework Specification v3.2
• Validation: r=0.89 
  (p < 0.001)

CORPUS & DESIGN:
• Dataset: Bolsonaro 2018 Campaign Speeches
• Temporal Coverage: 2018-01-15 to 2018-10-28
• Analysis Units: 127 speeches
• Phase Structure: 3 campaign phases

KEY EMPIRICAL FINDINGS:
• Strategic Discourse Evolution: Confirmed systematic repositioning across campaign phases
• Orthogonal Independence: r=0.2649 axis correlation
• Innovation Validation: High Populism + High Nationalism simultaneously achievable
• Trajectory Characteristics: 0.710 coordinate units total movement

STATISTICAL ROBUSTNESS:
• Cross-validation: r=0.89 with manual coding
• Coordinate Space Utilization: σ=0.279
• Phase Differentiation: σ=0.204

METHODOLOGICAL CONTRIBUTIONS:
• First computational application of orthogonal democratic tension theory
• Novel coordinate space representation resolving crowding-out problem
• Automated axis independence validation
• Longitudinal discourse trajectory analysis
• Cross-validated computational-manual coding correlation
